abstract: The Upshot; debunking of academic paper that found changing views on same-sex marriage may point to shortcomings in public polling methodology; polling world remains shielded from scrutiny, and pollsters rarely provide detailed methodological explanations that are necessary to replicate results; deeper problem is propensity of pollsters to skew results toward desired end, often in order to match results of other polls.
lead_paragraph: A social-science scandal raises questions about a lack of transparency in another field: public-opinion surveys.

headline.print_headline: Lack of Transparency a Problem for Pollsters
